definition: to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
broom
to sweep
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
surname Xing
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)

sentences.english: Don't be such a party pooper , the party has just started.
sentences.chinese: 不要那麼掃興，聚會纔剛剛開始。

sentences.english: Seemseven China has its spoilsports and moaners.
sentences.chinese: 看來中國也有自己的掃興者和抱怨者。

sentences.english: In the selection the lecturer neglected the negligible negative reflection on the election.
sentences.chinese: 在全集結演講者疏忽了對選舉的眇乎小哉的掃興深思。

sentences.english: The cold weather really put a dampener on our celebration last night.
sentences.chinese: 寒冷的天氣確實讓我們昨晚的慶祝活動有些掃興。

sentences.english: It was an anticlimax when they abandoned the game.
sentences.chinese: 他們放棄比賽，真是掃興。

sentences.english: Their mother's illness cast a damp over the holidays.
sentences.chinese: 母親的病使他們在假日中很掃興。

sentences.english: I couldn't help being concerned about the disappointment in Becky's eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我總禁不住想到貝姬眼裏流露出的掃興。

sentences.english: Do you want the kid to grow up thinking god's a spoilsport ?
sentences.chinese: 你想要小孩認爲上帝是一個掃興的人？

sentences.english: Hassles with in-laws could put a damper on your day.
sentences.chinese: 與姻親的矛盾可能會讓你掃興。

sentences.english: That killjoy ruined the fun by taking our beer away.
sentences.chinese: 那個掃興的傢伙把啤酒拿走了。

sentences.english: The election was a real non-event, only a few people voted.
sentences.chinese: 這次大選實在令人掃興，投票的人很少。

sentences.english: It is annoying when stockings ladder.
sentences.chinese: 長統襪抽絲時真叫人掃興。

sentences.english: There are few tasks more ungrateful, than for persons of modesty to speak their own praises. (No. 30)
sentences.chinese: 謹慎者去誇耀自己，沒有比這行爲更令人掃興的了。

sentences.english: One answer to these questions is that nobody likes a party pooper.
sentences.chinese: 這些問題的一個答案是，沒人喜歡掃興的人。

sentences.english: Say a sentence to disappoint you of words, maybe he was a romantic veteran.
sentences.chinese: 說句讓你掃興的話，沒準他是個風月老手。

definition: to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
hard to understand/incomprehensible
to have nothing to say (idiom)
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
cannot figure out/to be unable to take a lighter view/to take things too hard/to be depressed/to fret over trifles
stage wait/(fig.) awkward silence
to change one's mind/to go back on one's word
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
to be confused/to be baffled
to murmur endearments (idiom)/to get into a romantic relationship
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
gossip/hearsay/rumor
